content:
The exact length of the laser teeth whitening treatment and the number of sessions required can vary depending on the patient's individual needs and the dentist's recommendations. Typically, the treatment can take around 30 minutes to an hour, and most patients will see significant results after just one session. However, some patients may require multiple sessions to achieve their desired level of whitening. 

In terms of the duration of the whitening effect, it can vary from person to person depending on factors such as diet, oral hygiene habits, and lifestyle choices. Generally, the whitening effect can last anywhere from several months to a year or longer. However, it's important to note that the results are not permanent, and patients may need touch-up treatments to maintain their whiter smile over time. Your dentist will likely provide you with aftercare instructions and recommendations for how to maintain your results for as long as possible.
